intro: Eupatorium hylophorbum, commonly known as white wood sage, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy, white to pale purple flower heads. The plant typically grows in wet or moist environments, such as marshes and stream banks, and can reach heights of up to 1.5 meters. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a rough texture, while its stems are often hairy. Eupatorium hylophorbum is also known for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
